newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Fazio urges clean-up of state finances.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Fazio urges clean-up of state finances.

text.p: Bank of Italy governor Antonio Fazio on Saturday urged the government to complete its efforts to bring order to Italy's state finances.
Fazio, pointing out that thousands of young Italians were unable to find work, said only a thorough clean-up of Italian accounts would spur the economic growth needed to create more jobs.

"The state, society -- if they truly care about the fair distribution (of wealth) which is the foundation of civil life -- cannot fail to acknowledge this reality," Fazio said in a speech at the final session of Italy's Roman Catholic Bishops' Conference.
Prime Minster Romano Prodi was present at the conference.
Fazio added that monetary stability must go hand-in-hand with reform of state finances.
He said monetary stability "defends the savings of large sections of the population in the form of financial investments made to cover the future needs of families". -- Rome newsroom +396 678 2501
